title: Sara bint Mashour Al Saud - Wikipedia
snippet: Sara bint Mashour Al Saud (Arabic: سارة بنت مشهور آل سعود) is a member of the Saudi royal family and wife of Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who is her first cousin. She is a granddaughter of King Abdulaziz.

title: Salman of Saudi Arabia - Wikipedia
snippet: Salman's third wife is Fahda bint Falah Al Hithlain, granddaughter of Rakan bin Hithlain and great-granddaughter of Dhaydan bin Hithlain, leaders of the Al Ajman tribe. U.S. intelligence officials believe that King Salman has been kept apart from Princess Fahda for several years, on the orders ...

title: Princess Fahda, Wife of Saudi King Salman, Arrives in Tangier for Vacation
snippet: Princess Fahda bint Falah Al Hithlain, wife of Saudi Arabia’s King Salman bin Abdulaziz and mother of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, has chosen Morocco to spend her personal vacation.

title: Fahda bint Falah Al Hithlain - Wikipedia
snippet: Fahda married King Salman in 1984. She is thirty years younger than him. She has six children with King Salman: Crown Prince and Prime Minister Mohammed, Prince Turki, Defense Minister Prince Khalid, Prince Nayef, Prince Bandar and Prince Rakan. Her second eldest son, Turki, is a businessman.

title: Who is Princess Sara bint Mashour bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, Wife of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud of Saudi Arabia? 3 Facts You Need To Know
snippet: The STREAM centre, ilmi (which means “My Knowledge” in Arabic) is scheduled to open in 2025. On April 6, 2008 HRH Princess Sara bint Mashour bin Abdulaziz Al Saud married Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman Al Saud.
